100% Proof

---------------------------------------------------------------------

In the Land of Grey and Pink is an album by progressive rock band Caravan, released in 1971. According to Allmusic, "it is considered by many to be the pinnacle release from Caravan." It has remained in the catalogue ever since its original release in 1971. Along with Soft Machine, Caravan were a leading exponent of what became known as "the Canterbury sound" Ã¢â‚¬â€œ a concoction of styles including jazz, classical and traditional English influences. In the Q and Mojo Classic Special Edition Pink Floyd & The Story of Prog Rock, the album came No. 19 in its list of "40 Cosmic Rock Albums".

Notes

Cardboard sleeve reissue from Caravan features the high-fidelity Platinum SHM-CD format (compatible with standard CD players) and DSD remastering in 2014 based on the original analog tape in UK (HR cutting / subject to change). The cardboard sleeve (gatefold) faithfully replicates the artwork of UK limited edition's LP. Includes an obi featuring a miniature version of Japan limited edition's LP.
